review_title: Low pay, high turnover, horrible micromanaging
pros: The people you work with. I made good friends.
cons: Very low pay. My current employer didn't think they could match what I was making at Archbold until I told them. They laughed and offered me 30k more. You have to document every second of your day in a report and if you have less than 7 hours you get in trouble. Every single day. Horrible micromanaging, all supervisors are older and so detached from what actually happens. It's sad. Saw about 20 people come and go before and after I left.

pros: The hospital is a major employer in the community, providing wonderful well-paying jobs to residents in the area. My husband and I have experienced both inpatient and outpatient services, and the care was always exemplary.

pros: The area I work in is nice,for the most part its OK.
cons: The EVS department as a whole is the worst I have ever had the misfortune to work for.Most of the supervisors are just plan disrespectful and rude to the evs workers.There is a lot if gossip about employee's and favoritism. You will be told your not allowed to do a,b,c and d.The next person does all over the above and no one says a word.We aren't suppose to work overtime, one specific evs worker is called upon to work any and all extra hours.Our pay is horrible.The management looks at us like we are garbage.He won't even address us when he sees us.We are basically treated like servants.

review_title: Knowledgeable & compassionate staff, state-of-the art facilities & technology; top-notch health-care organization!
pros: During my 25 years working for Archbold, I have always felt that providing our patients with the best care possible is the number one focus of all employees, regardless of the employee's role. My fellow coworkers share my passion and desire to care for every patient as if they are our family members. This is extremely important to me. Though some may perceive being "nice", "compassionate" and "caring" as basic and not immensely important, I strongly disagree. This is the very foundation of the work that we do. If a clinician, or any other employee who interacts with patients, does not possess this sincere desire to help others, the patient will not receive good care and it can even adversely effect the patient's outcome. Once that genuine foundation of caring and compassion is well-established and nurtured (every morning prior to work, I pray for all of our patients and ask God to guide my hands, heart, and mind to do the right thing for each and every one of them), then clinical knowledge and experience is built to ensure that each patient is receiving evidence-based care in accordance with the latest guidelines for care and latest research. We never stop caring for the patients, and we never stop learning. This is the Archbold way, and I am exceptionally proud to be a part of such a fine organization. I have had patients come to us who live 50+ miles from Archbold, but they state that the excellent care and loving staff is worth the drive! Though I have had many job offers from Johns Hopkins, Vanderbilt, Emory, and Shands, I plan to stay at Archbold, as I truly feel that the care we provide is on par with these fine, academic institutions. I have been a part of Archbold's growth for 25 years now, and it has been spectacular. The commitment from the organization as a whole to grow and become even better than we were yesterday continues, and I look forward to growing right along with the organization until retirement! While working at Archbold, I worked throughout college as I obtained my Batchelor's, Master's, and Doctorate degrees! Archbold supported me 100% as I pursued higher education to provide the best care possible to my patients. I must also add that I was recently diagnosed with a serious, chronic health problem that necessitated I transfer to a new position for the protection of my health. Archbold immediately worked with me, found a perfect fit for me, went above and beyond to accommodate me and find a position that utilizes my talents, benefits the organization, and keeps me safe! You just cannot find a better employer than Archbold!
cons: In my many years at Archbold, I have noticed that communication between administration and clinicians is somewhat lacking (and sadly, completely lacking at times in the past). Of course, this leads to confusion, disorganization, and inefficiencies, just to name a few. However, I do feel that this has improved over the past 2-3 years, so I am pleased that this was obviously recognized and being improved.

review_title: Very nice hospital in a great small town
pros: Forward thinking medical center with great health and dental benefits. Variety of opportunities in the organization. Centrally located in a very nice part of town and less than a mile to downtown.

Staff does not feel valued.
